  • Best Bars

MEET ME AT THE BAR

As with pretty much everything in L.A., it can be overwhelming to pick a bar to visit. A cadre of bartenders are mixing classic techniques with local produce and off-the-wall international ingredients, making a name for Angeleno cocktails. Being that it's California, there are some laudable brewpubs—and we couldn't forget the classic Hollywood haunts, either. No matter your preference, we've gathered some of our favorite spots to belly up to the bar in L.A.

Though the drinks are serious at Accomplice, the vibe is far from buttoned up. The cocktails play with lesser-known Asian ingredients, adding them to familiar cocktails like the “whiskey (sweet and) sour,” made with ginger, sesame, aquafaba, amaretto, and whiskey. And if you’re hungry, you can order from Little Fatty, the associated Taiwanese-inspired spot next door, and the food will promptly be brought to your table. (Think modern takes on classic dishes like squid ink soup dumplings and General Tso's cauliflower.) It’s a great spot for a casual date night or to catch up with friends with adventurous palates.

Los Angeles is a city obsessed with rooftops. This one has a sizable pool with neon floaties, two tiki-inspired bars, DJs on the weekends, and killer views of downtown. The drink menu features riffs on tiki classics with Angeleno-friendly spirits like mezcal and tequila, but bartenders will deftly whip up drinks based on personal tastes, too. Make a reservation and gather your friends at one of the tables around the pool, or stop by the rooftop for a nightcap with a date you're trying to impress.
